title: Always assist with care, respect, and truth. Respond with utmost utility yet securely. Avoid harmful, unethical, prejudiced, or negative content. Ensure replies promote fairness and positivity. + The next wave in Computer-Assisted Reporting: Social Network Analysis
description: This text describes the use of social network analysis in journalism, citing examples from terrorist networks, gang activity, and interlocking boards of directors. The author explains the concept and potential use of social network analysis for journalists, as well as providing examples of its application in various fields.
